content.description: Start shares a common bolt with Repeat Offender, the climb to the left.  Head up and right on good holds with long moves. Save some juice for thin moves near top.

Start infront of the low right angle roof, pull a hard move up and right, and continue up three bolts on a large variety of thin varnish plates to the car sized hueco / cave.  The varnish plates are surprisingly solid but far too thin to survive hard abuse, pull gingerly!   Reach as far as you can to clip the bolt above the cave, then pull up and out of its left side.  Continue up, mostly left of the bolt line, doing your best to avoid the thin flakes to your left.  Pull one final crux to the anchors where the holds seem to disappear for a second.  Either stick clip or stem up to pre-clip the first bolt.
content.location: Climbs the line of bolts that lead through the very left side of the car sized hueco / cave 25ft up the wall and about 40-50ft from the left end of the crag. Starts in front of a ground level right-angle roof.  This route seems much younger than the other routes at this wall, expect friable holds.

content.description: Thin moves off the ground lead to jugs. Shake out, then punch on through using a variety of technique to follow a thin seam which curves up and right. Move slightly left and follow bolts straight up face to chain anchors. Super fun.
Stem to good hold. Hard crimping and sequenced feet through the 2nd bolt followed by sustained moderate climbing.
content.location: High on the ramp on the left end of the wall. starts below a small left facing ear of rock.   This route seems much younger than the other routes at this wall, expect friable holds.

content.description: Climb the start of the route that is shared with Yearnin and Learnin, a long leftward traverse around the second or third bolt will see you to the upper part of the route, where you will be trending leftward more than you would think.  Head toward the anchor that is shared with Armed and Dangerous. This route has suspect rock, just like all the others I tried here.
content.location: This route is the fourth from the south end. There seems to be a route here that is not in the guidebook.  Making the count of routes here different from the book.

content.description: A short sport route. The second bolt is pretty bad.
content.location: The first route on left side of the Hall of Fame.

content.description: Thin start leads to fun climbing on solid varnished rock.

Start on the junky slab below the gray stripe on the steep face above.  Carefully climb your way up to the first bolt, which is about 20 feet up.  Clip the first bolt, catch your breath, and head up the beautiful, juggy, steep water streak. No hold is smaller than a finger pad, but the route is so steep that you are still working for it.   

  If it were not for the sketchy start to the route, I would give this route four stars.  One of the best steep 12a's in Red Rock.
content.location: This route is located near the Hall of Fame area.  Exit the Hall of Fame to the South (the end facing the canyons), and turn right (west) and head towards gullies that lead south and down.  The left most gully is the easiest to negotiate.  Once at the bottom, again head right (west) and look up.  The route sits by itself on a big boulder to the right of a large, smooth scoop feature.

content.description: Start with thin hand and foot matches to jugs.  Move out right to crux roof with slopey holds.  Gets better everytime you climb the route.  Awesome photo spot, bring your camera.
content.protection: 3 bolts to chain anchors over roof

content.description: Starts at a small roof, and climbs up the wall just to the right of a huge pod.
content.location: It is the 3rd bolted route from left to right.

content.description: Tricky start leads to some pretty cool climbing up some huecos.  The climbing is good, but the rock is a little but flaky in places.
content.location: Located inside the hall of fame, this route is the fifth route from the right. There appears to be more routes here than are in the guide book.

content.description: This wall is a great escape for the day. It combines a variety of fun and technical routes with a magnificent view of Bridge Mountain.   Due to the wall's northern exposure, most routes are in the shade until late afternoon (with the exception of Bull Rider). Well worth the walk.
